module.name: Translations
module.short: Contains classes and routines used to load/check/maintain translations from .po (portable object) files.

descr.p: translations.pas contains classes and routines used to load/check/maintain translations from .po (portable object) files.
translations.pas is part of the LazUtils package.
Initial authors: Mattias Gaertner, Bart Broersma, Giuliano Colla
Example 1: Load a specific .po file
Example 2: Load the current language file using the GetLanguageID function:

element.name: TLanguageID
element.short: Record type used to return language and country codes/identifiers for a locale.

descr.p: TLanguageID is the type returned from the GetLanguageID function.

element.name: TLanguageID.LanguageID
element.short: Language ID is the combined values for the LanguageCode and CountryCode members. For example: 'en_US'.

element.name: TLanguageID.LanguageCode
element.short: ISO 639-1 or 639-2 language code. For example: 'en' or 'eng'.

element.name: TLanguageID.CountryCode
element.short: ISO 3166 country code. For example: 'US' or 'USA'.

element.name: TStringsType
element.short: Format used in the string table passed to the TPOFile.UpdateStrings method.

descr.p: Determines the inner method called to process values passed in the argument.

element.name: TStringsType.stLrj
element.short: Lazarus resource string table in JSON format.

element.name: TStringsType.stRst
element.short: FPC resource string table (prior to FPC 2.7.1).

element.name: TStringsType.stRsj
element.short: FPC resource string table in JSON format (since FPC 2.7.1).

element.name: GetLanguageID
element.short: Gets a record with the language code and country code for the current system locale.

descr.p: GetLanguageID is a TLanguageID function which returns a record with language code (in ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-2) and country code (in ISO 3166) for the current system locale. The implementation is based on GetLanguageIDs procedure from the GetText unit, but is rewritten to have the following properties:

ol.li: Language and country codes are returned in ISO formats on Windows.
A Unix locale identifier is properly parsed and language/country codes are properly extracted.
Don't assume that language code is always two-letters (ISO 639-1), it can have a bigger length (e. g. three letters, like in ISO 639-2).

Provides support for locale information on Darwin platforms. macOS does not set language environment variables for GUI applications which are not started from a terminal. This routine ensures that locale information is available for both console applications and GUI applications, independent of environment variables like LC_ALL / LC_MESSAGES / LANG, or Application bundle settings. The locale information uses ISO formats like `ru_RU`, `zh_CN`, or `it_IT`.
Returns the locale information in a record type. This allows additional fields in a backwards-compatible manner. Currently it contains language ID, language code and country code.

descr.p: GetLanguageID is used in the implementation of routines in the lcltranslator.pas unit, and can be called by other components and classes which use the localization feature.

element.name: GetLanguageID.Result
element.short: TLanguageID instance with the language identifier and country code for the current locale.

element.name: TTranslateUnitResult
element.short: Represents the return value for the TranslateUnitResourceStrings function.

descr.p: TTranslateUnitResult is an enumeration type with values that can be returned from the overloaded TranslateUnitResourceStrings function.

element.name: TTranslateUnitResult.turOK
element.short: Resources were successfully translated.

element.name: TTranslateUnitResult.turNoLang
element.short: The language identifier was omitted or a .po file for the language was not found .

element.name: TTranslateUnitResult.turNoFBLang
element.short: The fallback language identifier was omitted or a .po file for the language was not found.

element.name: TTranslateUnitResult.turEmptyParam
element.short: The unit file name or the base file name argument was not specified.

element.name: TTranslationStatistics
element.short: Represents translation statistics calculated for the key/value pairs in a .po translation file.

descr.p: TTranslationStatistics is the type used to implement the statistics property in TPOFile. It contains information about the key/value pairs in the .po (Portable Object) file such as: successful translations, untranslated item count, and number of entries with the "fuzzy" keyword for unverified translations.

element.name: TTranslationStatistics.Translated
element.short: Number of keys with a valid localized value.

element.name: TTranslationStatistics.Untranslated
element.short: Number of keys with no localized value.

element.name: TTranslationStatistics.Fuzzy
element.short: Number of keys with the "fuzzy" keyword indicating an unverified localized value.

element.name: TPOFileItem
element.short: Represents a single key/value pair in a .po file which maps a string to its translated value.

descr.p: TPOFileItem is a class used to represent a key/value pair defined in a .po (Portable Object) file. It provides members, properties, and methods used to process, store, and maintain a single translation defined in a .po file.
TPOFileItem is the type used for the POItems property in TPOFile. It is also passed as an argument or used as the return value for methods in TPOFile.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Tag
element.short: Arbitrary value which can be used to identify the translation entry.

descr.p: Tag is a public Integer member which contains an arbitrary value used to locate or maintain the translation entry. Tag is used in TPOFile methods like UntagAll and RemoveTaggedItems, and in the UpdatePOFile routine.

element.name: TPOFileItem.LineNr
element.short: Line number in a .po file where the first line for the translation entry was found.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Comments
element.short: Contains the comments with the notes for translators, flag values, et. al. for the translation entry.

descr.p: Comments is a public String member which contains the comment lines which occur at the start of the translation entry. It is an empty string ('') if no comments were found prior to the key/value pair in Original and Translation. If multiple comment lines (starting with the '#' character) are found, and line ending sequence is added at the end of each comment.
The value in Comments is detected when the ReadPOText method in TPOFile is called to process the contents of a .po file, and stored when the FillItem method in TPOFile is called.
A comment line starts with the # character and relates to the first entry after the comment. Comment types and uses are defined as follows:

dl.dd: Contains a note for translators. Normally, this is the only comment that is manually written.
Comment was extracted from the source code with the Gettext tool.

Contains a reference to the source code with the message ids translated using the file. A Colon (':') is used as a delimiter between distinct values in the reference. For instance: '#: lazarusidestrconsts:lisdonotshowsplashscreen:224'.

dd.p: Flag values from the translator or the Gettext tool. Unlike other comments, these lines may be handled or applied in the application. The comma-delimited list of flags may be used to apply the translation based on the comment type.

"fuzzy" is inserted by a translator when the translated value might not be a correct translation. When verified, the "fuzzy" attribute can be removed in the .po file. A translation with the "fuzzy" flag is not applied in the application.
"badformat" indicates the message ID or translated value has an invalid format. A translation with the "badformat" flag is not applied in the application.

"object-pascal-format" and "no-object-pascal-format"indicate that the message ID or translated value does or does not use the format for the Object Pascal language. These are generated by automated PO processing tools.

dl.dd: Represents the previous (older) msgid, msgstr, or msgctxt value for the message ID which follows the comment.

element.name: TPOFileItem.IdentifierLow
element.short: Lowercase variant of the message identifier or untranslated value.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Original
element.short: Original untranslated value prior to localization using the value in Translation.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Translation
element.short: Translated or localized value for the message identifier.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Flags
element.short: Comma-delimited list of Flag names found in the comments for the translation entry.

element.name: TPOFileItem.PreviousID
element.short: Prior message ID used for the value in Original.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Context
element.short: Contains the msgctxt (message context) for the key/value pair.

descr.p: Context provides a context used differentiate identifiers with the same untranslated value. Please note that an empty context string ("") and an absent msgctxt line do not mean the same thing.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Duplicate
element.short: Indicates if the key/value pair is a duplicate of a previous entry.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create stores the values passed as arguments to the method to the members in the class instance. It also initializes internal members used in the class instance.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Create.TheIdentifierLow
element.short: Lowercase value for the message identifier (msgid).

element.name: TPOFileItem.Create.TheOriginal
element.short: The original untranslated value for the message identifier.

element.name: TPOFileItem.Create.TheTranslated
element.short: Translated value (msgstr) for the message identifier.

element.name: TPOFileItem.ModifyFlag
element.short: Examines and updates the Flags property for the specified values.

element.name: TPOFileItem.ModifyFlag.Result
element.short: True if the Flags property has been modified in the method.

element.name: TPOFileItem.ModifyFlag.AFlags
element.short: Comma-delimited list of flags accepted in the method.

element.name: TPOFileItem.ModifyFlag.Check
element.short: True causes an existing flag value to be removed. False causes a missing flag value to be added.

element.name: TPOFileItem.InitialFuzzyState
element.short: Indicates whether the translation entry is marked with the "fuzzy" state comment.

descr.p: InitialFuzzyState is a read-only Boolean property which indicates if the key/value pair was marked with the "fuzzy" comment in the .po file. The default value for the property is False. It is used when generating translation statistics when the .po file is processed.

element.name: TPOFileItem.VirtualTranslation
element.short: Indicates whether the translation is included in statistics generated when a .po file is processed and applied.

descr.p: VirtualTranslation is a read-only Boolean property which indicates whether the translation entry had an actual value in its identifier and translated value. The default value for the property is False. True indicates that both msgid and msgstr were empty, per the convention used for a .po file header. Translations entries which are virtual are not included in the translation statistics.

element.name: TPOFile
element.short: Class used to represent a .po file with translation entries for a single target language.

descr.p: TPOFile is a class which provides access to a file with translation entries used to localize a source file to the language or locale defined in a .po (Portable Object) file. .po files are part of the GNU gettext tool set used to produce and update translation files. Information about the .po file format can be found at:

TPOFile provides properties and methods used to load and save translation entries using a file, stream, or resource. The Header property contains the header information for the .po file, and may contain information about: the MIME version and content transfer encoding, target language, plural forms, and generation tools. Use the POItems property to access the translation entries defined in the .po file.
TPOFile also provides Statistics about the translations applied to a source file when the Translate method is called.

element.name: TPOFile.FItems
element.short: Member with the list of TPOFileItem instances in POItems.

element.name: TPOFile.FIdentifierLowToItem
element.short: Member with the lowercase identifier to TPOFileItem mapping.

element.name: TPOFile.FOriginalToItem
element.short: Member with the original value to TPOFileItem mapping.

element.name: TPOFile.FCharSet
element.short: Member with the value for the CharSet property.

element.name: TPOFile.FHeader
element.short: Member with the value for the Header property.

element.name: TPOFile.FAllEntries
element.short: Member with the scope for the translations applied from the .po file.

element.name: TPOFile.FTag
element.short: Member with the value for the Tag property.

element.name: TPOFile.FModified
element.short: Member with the value for the Modified property.

element.name: TPOFile.FHelperList
element.short: Member with the string list used to convert the .po file in the SaveToStrings method.

element.name: TPOFile.FPoName
element.short: Member with the value for the POName and PORename properties.

element.name: TPOFile.Remove
element.short: Gets the translation entry at the specified ordinal position in POItems and removes it from the list.

element.name: TPOFile.Remove.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in POItems for the translation entry removed in the method.

element.name: TPOFile.Remove.Result
element.short: TPOFileItem removed from the list.

element.name: TPOFile.GetCount
element.short: Gets the value for the Count property.

element.name: TPOFile.GetCount.Result
element.short: Value for the Count property.

element.name: TPOFile.SetCharSet
element.short: Updates the value in the CharSet property.

descr.p: SetCharSet ensures that CharSet contains 'UTF-8' when an empty value ('') is passed in the AValue argument. Please note that SetCharSet is not the write access specifier for the CharSet property; CharSet is defined as read-only.

element.name: TPOFile.SetCharSet.AValue
element.short: New value for the CharSet property.

element.name: TPOFile.GetPoItem
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed POItems property.

element.name: TPOFile.GetPoItem.Result
element.short: Value for the indexed POItems property.

element.name: TPOFile.GetPoItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the TPOFileItem instance used as the property value.

element.name: TPOFile.ReadPOText
element.short: Reads the content for the .po file from the specified source.

descr.p: ReadPOText is an overloaded method used to load translation entries from the specified source into the class instance. The overloaded variants allow the .po content to be loaded from a TStream instance or a String.

The TStream-based variant stores the content starting at the current stream position to a String value. The String-based variant is called examine and process the values. The stream position is not reset before or after reading values from the stream.

The String-based variant reads lines of text from the Txt argument and performs actions to create and populate the POItems in the class instance. It accounts for both the header in the .po file and the comment lines which occur prior to a translation entry. Values for message Identifiers (msgid), translations (msgstr), and Contexts (msgctxt) are handled in the method. If the file header indicates that a content encoding other than UTF-8 is used in the .po file, its content is transcoded by calling ConvertEncoding.
Use SavetoStrings or SaveToFile to store updated values in the class instance.

element.name: TPOFile.ReadPOText.AStream
element.short: TStream instance with the translation entries for the .po file.

element.name: TPOFile.ReadPOText.Txt
element.short: String with the translation entries for the .po file.

element.name: TPOFile.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overloaded constructor for the class instance. The overloaded variants allow the class to be created and populated from a TStream, a .po file, or uninitialized for use with an internal resource.
Create allocates resources needed in the class instance, and sets the default values for its members.

For the variant with the AFilename argument, a TFileStream instance is created for use in the overloaded Create method. The CreateHeader method is called if a value has not been assigned to the Header property.
The stream-based variant is used to load values from the TStream argument. The ReadPOText method is called to load, process, and apply the translation entries found in the .po file.

element.name: TPOFile.Create.Full
element.short: Use False when loading from an internal resource. Default is True.

element.name: TPOFile.Create.AFilename
element.short: Name for the .po file loaded into the class instance.

element.name: TPOFile.Create.AStream
element.short: TStream instance with the translation entries loaded in the method.

element.name: TPOFile.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

element.name: TPOFile.Translate
element.short: Retrieves the translation entry for the specified identifier and returns the translated value.

descr.p: Translate is a method used to retrieve the translation entry for a given identifier, and return the translated value for the TPOFileItem.
Identifier contains the msgid for the translation entry.
OriginalValue contains the untranslated value for the Identifier.

A translation is loaded only when it exists, and does not include 'fuzzy' or 'badformat' in its flag values. This is done to mimic gettext behavior and to avoid crashes related to formatting argument mismatches.

The return value contains the Translation property for the TPOFileItem when found. When not found, the value in the Original property is used. If the translated value is an empty string (''), the untranslated value in OriginalValue is used as the return value for the method.
Translate is called from the implementation routine used in the TranslateUnitResourceStrings routine.

element.errors: Raises an exception with the message 'TPOFile.Translate Inconsistency' if a translation is not found (or created) for the Identifier, or the flags for the translation include 'fuzzy' or 'badformat'.

element.name: TPOFile.Translate.Result
element.short: Translated value for the identifier, or the original value if a translation cannot be located or used.

element.name: TPOFile.Translate.Identifier
element.short: Identifier (msgid) for the translation entry used in the method.

element.name: TPOFile.Translate.OriginalValue
element.short: Original untranslated value for the specified Identifier.

element.name: TPOFile.CharSet
element.short: Character set used for the contents of the .po file.

descr.p: CharSet is a read-only String property which contains the character set encoding used in the .po file or stream. Its value is captured from the 'content-type' header included in the .po file. If omitted in the .po file, the value 'UTF-8' is used. When CharSet is set to a value other than 'UTF-8', the ConvertEncoding routine is called to transcode the content in the .po file to UTF-8.
Use SetCharSet to manually override the character set used for the translation entries in the class instance.

element.name: TPOFile.Report
element.short: Generates output with the values in the Header and the translation entries in the .po file.

descr.p: Report is an overloaded method in TPOFile used to generate output with the values from the Header and the POItems translation entries for the .po file. The overloaded variants allow the output to be sent to the DebugLn routine or stored in a TStrings instance.
Use DisplayHeader to control whether values in the Header section of the .po file are included the output for the report.
Use StartIndex and StopIndex to specify a range of translation entries found in POItems in the output for the report.
The variant with the Log parameter allows the output to be stored in the TString instance passed in the argument.

element.name: TPOFile.Report.StartIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the first translation entry included in the output.

element.name: TPOFile.Report.StopIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the last translation entry included in the output.

element.name: TPOFile.Report.DisplayHeader
element.short: True to display values found the Header for the .po file.

element.name: TPOFile.Report.Log
element.short: TStrings instance where the output for the report is stored.

element.name: TPOFile.CreateHeader
element.short: Ensures that a TPOFileItem instance is allocated for the Header property (when not already assigned).

descr.p: CreateHeader sets the value for the Translation property in Header to the default content type for the .po file:
CreateHeader is called from the file-based variant of the Create constructor, and from the SaveToStrings method when Header has not been assigned.

element.name: TPOFile.UpdateStrings
element.short: Adds or updates translation entries in POItems using the values specified in InputLines.

descr.p: UpdateStrings is a method used to refresh the translation entries in the .po file from the values specified in the InputLines argument. Values in InputLines are stored using the format specified in the SType argument, and includes:

dl.dd: Lazarus resource string table in JSON format
FPC resource string table in JSON format (since FPC 2.7.1)

descr.p: UpdateStrings provides nested routines used to read the various formats and to apply the translation entries to POItems. Each identifier and value are read from InputLines and UpdateItem is called to store the data.
UpdateStrings is used in the implementation of the UpdatePOFile routine.

element.name: TPOFile.UpdateStrings.InputLines
element.short: TStrings instance with the translation entries stored in the .po file class instance.

element.name: TPOFile.UpdateStrings.SType
element.short: Identifies the format for the identifiers and values in the InputLines argument.

element.name: TPOFile.SaveToStrings
element.short: Stores values from Header and the sorted POItems to the specified string list.

descr.p: SaveToStrings is a method used to store values from the .po file class instance to the TStrings instance in OutLst. Values in the Header and POItems properties are stored in OutLst.

SaveToStrings calls CreateHeader to ensure that the Header property has been allocated for the class instance. Values in POItems are sorted (without case sensitivity) in Identifier order prior to storing the values in OutLst.
Values written to OutLst are stored in the PO (Portable Object) format used by the GNU gettext localization library. The following properties from the TPOFileItem entries in Items are stored:

dl.dd: Stored with the '# ' prefix but not quoted in any form.
Stored with the '#| msgid' prefix using escaped values for Quote ("), Backslash (\), and Tab (#9) characters.
Stored with the 'msgid' prefix using escaped values for Quote ("), Backslash (\), and Tab (#9) characters.
Stored with the 'msgstr' prefix using escaped values for Quote ("), Backslash (\), and Tab (#9) characters.

descr.p: Properties which have a blank value ('') are not stored in OutLst.
Use SaveToFile to store the contents of the .po file to a specified file name.

element.name: TPOFile.SaveToStrings.OutLst
element.short: TStrings instance where the header and translation entries in the class are stored.

element.name: TPOFile.SaveToFile
element.short: Stores values from Header and the sorted POItems to the specified file name.

descr.p: SaveToFile is a method used to store the contents in the .po file class instance to the file name specified in the AFilename argument. AFilename contains an optional path and the file name and extension where the values are stored.

SaveToFile creates a temporary TStringList instance and calls the SaveToStrings method to populate the list with the Header and Items in the class instance. Its contents are stored to the location specified in AFilename. If AFilename already exists, it is overwritten.

Value are written to the file in the PO (Portable Object) format used by the GNU gettext localization library. See SaveToStrings for more information about the properties included in the output and their storage formats.
Use the overloaded Create variant with a file name argument to load a .po file class instance from a specified file using the .po format.

element.name: TPOFile.SaveToFile.AFilename
element.short: Name of the file where the values in the .po file are stored.

element.name: TPOFile.UpdateItem
element.short: Adds or updates a translation entry which has the specified Identifier.

descr.p: UpdateItem is a method used to update a translation entry in Items with the msgid specified in the Identifier argument. It stores the values from the Identifier, Original, and Flags arguments to the TPOFileItem instance. If a translation entry with the specified identifier is not found in Items (POItems), it is added.

The ProcessingTranslation argument indicates whether values in the Flags argument are synchronized to the values in the TPOFileItem instance. When set to True, the "fuzzy" flag value in the POItems entry is retained and merged with the new Flag values.
UpdateItem calls the FillItem method to validate and apply the updated translation entry to the TPOFileItem instance in Items.
UpdateItem is used in methods like UpdateStrings and UpdateTranslation in TPOFile.

element.name: TPOFile.UpdateItem.Identifier
element.short: Identifier (msgid) for the translation entry.

element.name: TPOFile.UpdateItem.Original
element.short: Untranslated value for the specified identifier.

element.name: TPOFile.UpdateItem.Flags
element.short: Optional comma-delimited list of flags for the translation entry.

module.element: True if the translation entry is being synchronized with a base (.pot) file; updates translation flags but retains the fuzzy flag state. False if flags in a base (.pot) file are kept as is, but the item translation must be empty there.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem
element.short: Stores argument values to the specified translation entry.

descr.p: FillItem is a method used to store values passed in the specified arguments to the TPOFileItem instance in CurrentItem. If CurrentItem is Nil, a new TPOFileItem instance is created and used to stored the argument values. It is added to the Items in the class instance.

FillItem retrieves an existing TPOFileItem instance in Items and merges its properties into the values in CurrentItem. The value in CurrentItem is subsequently used to replace the translation entry in Items.
FillItem is used in methods like ReadPOText and UpdateItem in TPOFile.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem.CurrentItem
element.short: TPOFileItem instance where the argument values are stored.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem.Identifier
element.short: Identifier (msgid) for the translation entry.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem.Original
element.short: Untranslated value (msgstr) for the message identifier.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem.Translation
element.short: Translated value for the entry.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem.Comments
element.short: Comments for the translation entry.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem.Context
element.short: Context (msgctxt) for the translation entry.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem.Flags
element.short: Comma-delimited list of flag values for the translation entry.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem.PreviousID
element.short: Previous (older) message identifier for the translation entry.

element.name: TPOFile.FillItem.LineNr
element.short: Line number in the .po file for the first line in the translation entry.

element.name: TPOFile.UpdateTranslation
element.short: Updates or removes translation entries in the .po file class based on the content in the specified .po file.

descr.p: UpdateTranslation is a method used to update translation entries in Items from the translation entries in the specified TPOFile instance. UpdateTranslation resets the value in Tag to 0 (zero) for all of the POItems in the class instance. It visits each of the POItems in BasePOFile, and calls UpdateItem to apply the Original and Flags members to the entries in Items.
UpdateTranslation removes any entries in Items which do not exist in BasePOFile. InvalidateStatistics is called to reset the internal flag which indicates that translation statistics are up-to-date.
UpdateTranslation is called from the UpdatePoFileTranslations routine when a .pot template file has been provided in its arguments.

element.name: TPOFile.UpdateTranslation.BasePOFile
element.short: Name for the .po file with the translation entries applied to the Items in the class.

element.name: TPOFile.UntagAll
element.short: Resets the value in the Tag property for all of the translation entries in Items.

descr.p: Iterates over the TPOFileItem instances in Items, and sets the value in each of the Tag properties to zero (0).
UntagAll is used in the UpdateTranslation method in TPOFile, and in the UpdatePOFile routine.

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveTaggedItems
element.short: Removes translation entries in POItems with the specified value in their Tag property.

descr.p: Visits the translation entries in Items in reverse order. It removes and frees each TPOFileItem instance in the Items list which has the specified value in its Tag member.

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveTaggedItems.aTag
element.short: Arbitrary numeric value for the tagged translations removed in the method.

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveIdentifier
element.short: Removes a translation entry in Items with the specified value in its identifier (msgid).

descr.p: No actions are performed in the method if AIdentifier is an empty string ('').

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveIdentifier.AIdentifier
element.short: Identifier for the translation entry located and removed in the method.

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveOriginal
element.short: Removes a translation entry in POItems with has the specified value as its Original untranslated value.

descr.p: RemoveOriginal visits each of the TPOFileItem instances in Items in reverse order. It removes the translation entry if the value in AOriginal is found in the multi-line value for the Original member in the TPOFileItem instance.
No actions are performed in the method if AOriginal is an empty string ('').

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveOriginal.AOriginal
element.short: Untranslated value to locate and remove in the method.

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveIdentifiers
element.short: Removes translation entries from Items which have the identifiers (msgids) in the specified string list.

descr.p: RemoveIdentifiers is a method used to remove translation entries in Items which have an identifier found in the AIdentifiers argument.
AIdentifiers is a TStrings instance which contains one or more identifiers to be removed in the method. Each identifier should be a separate line of text in the TStrings instance.
RemoveIdentifiers iterates over the lines of text in AIdentifiers and calls the RemoveIdentifier method for the identifier value.
No actions are performed in the method if the Count property in AIdentifiers is 0 (zero).

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveIdentifiers.AIdentifiers
element.short: TStrings instance with the identifiers located and removed in the method.

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveOriginals
element.short: Removes translation entries from Items which have the original untranslated values in the specified string list.

descr.p: No actions are performed in the method when the Count property in AOriginals is zero (0).

element.name: TPOFile.RemoveOriginals.AOriginals
element.short: TStrings instance with the untranslated values for translation entries removed in the method.

element.name: TPOFile.Tag
element.short: Arbitrary value used to identify the .po file and its associated translation entries.

element.name: TPOFile.Modified
element.short: Indicates whether values in the class instance have been modified since they were loaded from a .po file or stream.

element.name: TPOFile.Items
element.short: Provides access to the TFPList instance where translation entries are stored.

descr.p: Items is a read-only TFPList property with the container where translation entries are stored in the class instance. Each translation entry is stored as an object instance in the container, and must be cast to a TPOFileItem instance to access properties and methods specific to the type.

Items allows access to the properties and methods in the TFPList instance, such as: Add, Delete, Move, Remove, IndexOf, First, Last, and Count. They are used in the implementation of TPOFile methods which maintain the translation entries like: UpdateItem, FillItem, RemoveIdentifier, RemoveOriginal , et. al.

element.name: TPOFile.PoName
element.short: Name for the .po file loaded into the class instance.

descr.p: POName is a read-only String property with the name for the .po file loaded into the class instance. The property value is assigned in the Create constructor using the AFilename argument value passed to the method.

element.name: TPOFile.PoRename
element.short: Name for the .po file loaded into the class instance.

element.name: TPOFile.Statistics
element.short: Provides access to statistics for the translation entries in the .po file.

descr.p: Statistics is a read-only TTranslationStatistics property with information about the translation entries in the POItems property. The statistics reflect the number of entries with a translated value, without a translated value (blank), and those which cannot be used due to use of "fuzzy" or "badformat" flags in the translation.

An internal flag is maintained to indicate whether the statistics have already been calculated by reading the value for the property. They must be recalculated when the flag is reset after calling the InvalidateStatistics method; this occurs in both the Create constructor and the UpdateTranslation method.

element.name: TPOFile.InvalidateStatistics
element.short: Resets the internal flag which indicates that translation statistics has been calculated for the entries in POItems.

element.name: TPOFile.FindPoItem
element.short: Gets the translation entry with the specified identifier value.

element.name: TPOFile.FindPoItem.Result
element.short: TPOFileItem with the specified Identifier value, or Nil when not found.

element.name: TPOFile.FindPoItem.Identifier
element.short: Identifier (msgid) for the translation entry located in the method. The value is converted to lowercase and used to find the matching translation entry.

element.name: TPOFile.OriginalToItem
element.short: Gets the translation entry which has the specified original (untranslated) value.

element.name: TPOFile.OriginalToItem.Result
element.short: TPOFileItem with the specified Original value, or Nil when not found.

element.name: TPOFile.OriginalToItem.Data
element.short: Untranslated value for the entry located in the method.

element.name: TPOFile.PoItems
element.short: Provides indexed access to the translation entries in the class instance.

descr.p: POItems is an indexed TPOFileItem property which allows access to the translation entries in the class by their ordinal position. Index values must be in the range 0..Count-1.
Values in POItems are created when the ReadPOText method is called to load the content of a .po file or stream into the class instance.

element.name: TPOFile.PoItems.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the translation entry in the property value.

element.name: TPOFile.Count
element.short: Number of translation entries in the POItems for the class instance.

descr.p: Count is a read-only Integer property which contains the number of translation entries found in the class. It contains the value from the Count property in the list used to store the POItems instances in the class.

element.name: TPOFile.Header
element.short: Contains values for the header section in a .po file.

descr.p: Header is a read-only TPOFileItem property which contains values read from the header section in the .po file. The header section is the first entry in a PO file that has empty string for its message Identifier (msgid). It contains meta-information about the content in the file, and also how a plural (a line with Plural-Forms) needs to be handled for that language.
The Translation property in Header is used to store the metadata found in the header section for the .po file. For example:
descr.code:
"MIME-Version: 1.0
" "Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
" "Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
" "X-Generator: ztrans-tool
" "Last-Translator: Wiley Coyote
" "Language-Team: acmecorpllc.com
" "Plural-Forms: nplurals=2; plural=(n != 1);
" "Language: de
"
descr.p: Use of a header section is optional in the .po file. TPOFile includes the CreateHeader method to ensure that the Header property is allocated - even when the values are not present in the content for the .po file.

element.name: EPOFileError
element.short: Exception type raised when an error occurs in the UpdatePOFile or UpdatePOFileTranslations routines.

element.name: EPOFileError.ResFileName
element.short: Resource name where the exception was detected.

element.name: EPOFileError.POFileName
element.short: Name for the .po file where the exception occurred.

element.name: SystemCharSetIsUTF8
element.short: Indicates whether the default system character is UTF-8 for the platform.

descr.p: The LCL interfaces expect UTF-8 as the default character encoding. If you do not use UTF-8, install a proper widestring manager and set this variable to False. The default value for the variable is True.
Used in the UTF8ToSystemCharSet routine. When set to False, the UTF8ToSys routine is called to transcode a native UTF-8 string value to the system character set.
